intro: Parietaria roschanica, commonly known as the common wall-rocket, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically produces yellow flowers in clusters, and its leaves are heart-shaped with a distinctive waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky crevices. Parietaria roschanica is often found growing on walls and in damp, calcareous soils.
